channel.title: Telnet
channel.description: a few days ago i read about the telnet command that it can conncect to a computer. i've tried lots of time to connect to a computer but it never worked.and sometimes i had to wait a long time and then it says : Press a key to continue... i press a key then it says : Disconnected from host Can i fix this or is there any test server i can try to connect to?

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

[quote=“Scar, post:3, topic:17818”]could you explain a bit more about running a server??

i’ve searched for some information in google.and most of the websites tell you , you need a port scanner to scan open ports so you can connect to the remote pc.also if you’re using a port scanner the remote host can see you are doing a port scan and so he can see your ip and sue me or something

then they say you need a proxy so they would’nt know your real IP.but i’ve tried allot of programs to connect with the internet with a proxy but none of them has worked.everytime the program sets a proxy then i go to www.whatismyip.com and still i see the same IP like i had before i set a proxy with the program

any help is appreciated[/quote] Download proxyswticher. It gets you tons of new proxies and half of them work.

Read full topic

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @Scar Scar
item.description:
@Scar wrote:

oh nvm the proxy works

Read full topic

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @Scar Scar
item.description:
@Scar wrote:

frank_:

If you are trying to get into script kiddying, dont.

i’ve heard allot of people saying script kiddy and still i dont understand what it means??
is it like people who only use hacking software that already existed or something??

MoO:

yup, also I found that some Ip changers only configure IE to run under a proxy so that could be the reason for now having it change your i.p. if your running under mozzila firefox.

i’ve already tried with IE ,its the same…Ip still doesn’t change

Read full topic

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

yeah by going down this road you will probly become a script kiddy

Read full topic

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:5, topic:17818”]Telnet was one of the first forms of ‘hacking’.I would hardly call it script kid shit due to it requiring alot of knowledge.[/quote]Using a portscanner, then running a few perl/python scripts doesnt require any knowledge.
PortScanning is the key sign of a noob.

Read full topic

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @MoO MoO
item.description:
@MoO wrote:

yup, also I found that some Ip changers only configure IE to run under a proxy so that could be the reason for now having it change your i.p. if your running under mozzila firefox.

Telnet a computer that you know like for instance your brother/sister’s that way there is no chance of you getting into legal trouble.

Read full topic

item.description:

If you are trying to get into script kiddying, dont.

item.title: Telnet
item.dc:creator: @Scar Scar
item.description:
@Scar wrote:

could you explain a bit more about running a server??

i’ve searched for some information in google.and most of the websites tell you , you need a port scanner to scan open ports so you can connect to the remote pc.also if you’re using a port scanner the remote host can see you are doing a port scan and so he can see your ip and sue me or something

then they say you need a proxy so they would’nt know your real IP.but i’ve tried allot of programs to connect with the internet with a proxy but none of them has worked.everytime the program sets a proxy then i go to www.whatismyip.com and still i see the same IP like i had before i set a proxy with the program

any help is appreciated
